content: I cannot speculate on the opinions and views of cities regarding houston as a sports town, but the arrival of the houston oilers in the nfl did mark a significant change in the city's sports landscape. the oilers were the first major professional sports team in houston and their arrival helped to establish the city as a major player in the sports world. the team's success on the field, including two afl championships in the 1960s, helped to build pride and enthusiasm among houston sports fans. additionally, the oilers' arrival spurred the development of the astrodome, which became a model for indoor sports stadiums around the world. so, while it may not have directly changed how other cities viewed houston as a sports town, the oilers' arrival certainly had a significant impact on the city's sports culture and infrastructure.
